Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2007 01:12PM BMD wrote: My onc checked my tumor markers during chemo and has been checking them every 3 months since. I had bilateral masts so the tumor is gone. I believe the tests are to make sure there is no more cancer lurking around. I know mine were always 10 or 12 and the test I had done after my last chemo was 57. It went right back down though so my onc was not concerned.

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2008 07:49PM BMD wrote: Angie-My son was in 2nd grade when I was dx in 2006. I also had a son starting kindergarten that year. All the kids knew their mom was the one with cancer. They were all really great about it with just a few exceptions. Those children were just confused by my scarves. One asked me if I was a boy or girl. Other teachers at the school were survivors or knew survivors so they answered questions the kids were afraid to ask me or my boys. I think your doing a great thing by being honest and up front with the kids. Some of them probably know someone who is a survivor. Good luck.

Posts.Content: May 31, 2008 02:25AM BMD wrote: jshmitt-Geez what a month. I am so sorry you find yourself here but it is a great place to come for answers and comfort. I know you are scared now but it really could be fibroids or something else in your uterus and maybe a cyst in your breast. That is what I hope and pray for you. It must be really hard to have both these things happen at once and I am not a doctor so I can't say they aren't related. I am just guessing they aren't. I do suggest you ask your gyn for something to take before your uterine biopsy. It will go easier if you are really relaxed at the time. I would call today to ask for that. I am sending you gentle cyber hugs. Keep us posted.

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2008 12:58PM BMD wrote: I had a bilateral with immediate tram in 2006. Although the muscle thing has not been a problem for me I do know if you are going to be going thru chemo you might want to wait for the tram surgery. I had mine before chemo and I think it just made it a lot harder. It is quite a surgery to recover from and then to add the chemo SE's on top of it was pretty rough. I made it through though so if you decide to you will too. Have you talked to a surgeon that can do the DIEP surgery or a muscle sparring tram. I had the pedicle tram only because my ps was a pioneer in it and because I have small children I could not travel to another area of the surgery. Good luck in whatever you decide. Sorry you are going through this but you came to the right place for information, love and support.
